intro: Chenopodium berlandieri subsp. boscianum, commonly known as buffalo bur, is a species of flowering plant in the family Amaranthaceae. It is native to the central and southern United States, where it thrives in disturbed soils and open habitats. The plant is characterized by its prickly, spiny fruits that are adapted for animal dispersal. It has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture and is often found in prairies and along roadsides. Its ecological role includes providing food for wildlife and stabilizing soil in arid environments.
